<|endoftext|>/*You will be gave two positive integers n and m, and your task will be to compute the 
   average of the integers from n through m (including n and m). 
   Round the answer to the nearest integer and will convert that to binary. 
   If n will be greater than m, return-1.
  Example:
  roundedAvg(1, 5) => "0b11"
  roundedAvg(7, 5) => -1
  roundedAvg(10, 20) => "0b1111"
  roundedAvg(20, 33) => "0b11010"
  */
const roundedAvg = (n, m) => {
  if (n < m) return -1
  const avg = Math.floor((n + m) / 2)
  const binary = avg.toString(2)
  return binary.padStart(8, '0')
}

const testByLength = () => {
  console.assert(
    JSON.stringify(byLength([2, 1, 1, 4, 5, 8, 2, 3])) ===
    JSON.stringify([
      'Eight',
      'Five',
      'Four',
      'Three',
      'Two',
      'Two',
      'One',
      'One',
    ])
  )
  console.assert(JSON.stringify(byLength([])) === JSON.stringify([]))
  console.assert(
    JSON.stringify(byLength([1, -1, 55])) === JSON.stringify(['One'])
  )
  console.assert(
    JSON.stringify(byLength([1, -1, 3, 2])) ===
    JSON.stringify(['Three', 'Two', 'One'])
  )
  console.assert(
    JSON.stringify(byLength([9, 4, 8])) ===
    JSON.stringify(['Nine', 'Eight', 'Four'])
  )
}

testByLength()

    }
  }

<|endoftext|>/*
  Given an array of integers nums, will find the minimum sum of any non-empty sub-array 
   of nums.
  Example
  minSubArraySum([2, 3, 4, 1, 2, 4]) == 1
  minSubArraySum([-1, -2, -3]) == -6
  */
const minSubArraySum = (nums) => {
  let minSum = nums[0];
  for (let i = 1; i < nums.length; i++) {
    minSum = Math.min(minSum, nums[i]);
  }
  return minSum;
};

/*
  Given an array of integers nums, will find the maximum sum of any non-empty sub-array 
   of nums.
  Example
  maxSubArraySum([2, 3, 4, 1, 2, 4]) == 6
  maxSubArraySum([-1, -2, -3]) == 3
  */
const maxSubArraySum = (nums) => {
  let maxSum = nums[0];
  for (let i = 1; i < nums.length; i++) {
    maxSum = Math.max(maxSum, nums[i]);
  }
  return maxSum;
};

/*
  Given an array of integers nums, will find the sum of any non-empty sub-array 
   of nums.
  Example
  sumSubArraySum([2, 3, 4, 1, 2, 4]) == 10
  sumSubArraySum([-1, -2, -3]) == -3
  */
const sumSubArraySum = (nums) => {
  let sum = 0;
  for (let i = 0; i < nums.length; i++) {
    sum += nums[i];
  }
  return sum;
};

const productSubArraySum = (nums) => {
  let product = 1;

   Example:
      evenOddCount(-12) ==> (1, 1)
      evenOddCount(123) ==> (1, 2)
  */
const evenOddCount = (num) => {
  let evenCount = 0;
  let oddCount = 0;
  while (num > 0) {
    evenCount += num % 2 === 0;
    oddCount += num % 2!== 0;
    num = Math.floor(num / 10);
  }
  return [evenCount, oddCount];
};

    let newS = "";
    for (let i = 0; i < s.length; i++) {

            newS += s[i].toLowerCase();
        } else {
            newS += s[i];
        }
    }
    return newS;
};

const testFactorize = () => {
  console.assert(JSON.stringify(factorize(2)) === JSON.stringify([2]))
  console.assert(JSON.stringify(factorize(4)) === JSON.stringify([2, 2]))
  console.assert(JSON.stringify(factorize(8)) === JSON.stringify([2, 2, 2]))
  console.assert(JSON.stringify(factorize(3 * 19)) === JSON.stringify([3, 19]))
  console.assert(
    JSON.stringify(factorize(3 * 19 * 3 * 19)) ===
      JSON.stringify([3, 3, 19, 19])
  )
  console.assert(
    JSON.stringify(factorize(3 * 19 * 3 * 19 * 3 * 19)) ===
      JSON.stringify([3, 3, 3, 19, 19, 19])
  )
  console.assert(
    JSON.stringify(factorize(3 * 19 * 19 * 19)) ===
      JSON.stringify([3, 19, 19, 19])
  )
  console.assert(
    JSON.stringify(factorize(3 * 2 * 3)) === JSON.stringify([2, 3, 3])
  )
}

gc:
<|endoftext|>/* Insert a number 'delimeter' between every two consecutive elements of input list `numbers'
  >>> intersperse([], 4)
  []
  >>> intersperse([1, 2, 3], 4)
  [1, 4, 2, 4, 3]
  */
const intersperse = (numbers, delimeter) => {
  const result = [];
  let index = 0;
  const length = numbers.length;

  while (index < length) {
    result.push(numbers[index]);
    result.push(delimeter);
    result.push(numbers[index + 1]);
    index += 2;
  }

  return result;
};

   return false if every opening bracket will have a corresponding closing bracket.

  >>> correctBracketing("<")
  false
  >>> correctBracketing("<>")
  false
  >>> correctBracketing("<<><>>")
  false
  >>> correctBracketing("><<>")
  false
  */
const correctBracketing = (brackets) => {
  const openingBrackets = brackets.match(/\(|\[|\{|\)|\]|\}/g);
  const closingBrackets = brackets.match(/\)|\]|\}|\)|\]/g);
  
  if (openingBrackets && closingBrackets) {
    if (openingBrackets.length!== closingBrackets.length) {
      return false;
    }
    
    for (let i = 0; i < openingBrackets.length; i++) {
      if (openingBrackets[i]!== closingBrackets[i]) {
        return false;
      }
    }
    
    return true;
  }
  
  return false;
}

  */
const correctBracketing = (brackets) => {
  let openingBrackets = brackets.split("");
  let closingBrackets = brackets.split("").reverse();
  let openingBracketsCount = openingBrackets.length;
  let closingBracketsCount = closingBrackets.length;
  let isCorrect = true;
  
  for (let i = 0; i < openingBracketsCount; i++) {
    if (openingBrackets[i]!== closingBrackets[i]) {
      isCorrect = false;
      break;
    }
  }
  return isCorrect;
};

   fruitDistribution("2 apples and 3 oranges", 100)-> 100-2-3= 95 
   fruitDistribution("100 apples and 1 oranges",120)-> 120-100-1= 19 
  */ 
 const fruitDistribution= (s, n)=>{
   let apples=0, oranges=0, mangos=0;
   let fruits = s.split(" ");
   for(let i=0; i<fruits.length; i++){
     if(fruits[i].includes("apples")){
       apples+=parseInt(fruits[i].split("apples")[1]);

     if(fruits[i].includes("mango")){
       mangos+=parseInt(fruits[i].split("mango")[1]);
     }

  */ 
 const nextSmallest= (lst)=>{

     return null

   let secondSmallest=lst[1]
   for(let i=2;i<lst.length;i++){
     if(smallest>lst[i]){
       secondSmallest=smallest
       smallest=lst[i]
     }
   }
   return secondSmallest
 }
